thread.title: ‘A nationalist arguing Scotland can’t go it alone!’ Parliament ERUPTS after Sturgeon jibe
thread.title_full: ‘A nationalist arguing Scotland can’t go it alone!’ Parliament ERUPTS after Sturgeon jibe

title: ‘A nationalist arguing Scotland can’t go it alone!’ Parliament ERUPTS after Sturgeon jibe
text:
‘A nationalist arguing Scotland can’t go it alone!’ Parliament ERUPTS after Sturgeon jibe ‘A nationalist arguing Scotland can’t go it alone!’ Parliament ERUPTS after Sturgeon jibe NICOLA STURGEON was left reeling after an epic slap down from Labour's Kezia Dugdale, which was met by thundering applause in the Scottish Parliament. PUBLISHED: 13:31, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 13:52, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 
Kezia Dugdale tore into the SNP leader during FMQs on Thursday as she lambasted Ms Sturgeon for not fulfilling her general election vows to reverse George Osborne’s tax cuts. 
But it was an EPIC jibe from Dugdale that got the chamber roaring with laughter as Sturgeon was left red-faced about her double standards. 
Ms Dugdale said: “We have heard time and time again excuses made about who the richest could avoid paying more taxes, that there would be a mass exodus from Scotland, it’s just we normally hear it from the Troy Party, not from the First Minister. 
“It wasn’t just at the general election that the First Minister claimed to support the richest few paying their fair share, on the day of the Smith agreement to devolve the power over tax she told this chamber ‘if I was taking that decision now, yes, I would raise the top rate of income tax to 50p’. SCOTTISH PARLIAMENT TV Nicola Sturgeon was slapped down to massive applause Related articles 'You are surrounded by so many men' Nicola Sturgeon ' battles sexism 
“Yet now she has the power to reverse George Osborne’s tax cuts for the very richest and stop the cuts, she refuses to use it.” 
Continuing the seething attack on Nicola Sturgeon , the Scottish politician slammed the First Minister for not making good on the pledges which saw her rise to power. 
“This is the First Minister who made her name as the anti-austerity champion,” she said. 
“If the SNP can’t summon the courage to propose major progressive change at this moment in time, will they ever?" A nationalist First Minister arguing that Scotland can’t go at it alone on tax, really takes the biscuit Kezia Dugdale 
Appearing less than thrilled, Ms Sturgeon responded: “I’ll leave Labour, considering they battled for second place for this election, to indulge in political gestures. 
“I will get on with putting forward the proposals that will see this country governed progressively.” 
The SNP leader insisted the party was doing the right thing for the country as she said the changes her Government was proposing would generate an extra 2billion pounds to be invested in social services. 
Ms Sturgeon said: “I’ll get on with doing the right thing. That is why we are asking people in the top 10 per cent go income earners in our country to forego the George Osborne tax cut. Sturgeon's top moments
